Remarks: Connects Downtown West End with Memorial Drive and Kensington ; named after Louise Cushing , daughter of William Henry Cushing , Calgary mayor from 1900 to 1901

Carries: C-Train Route 201 and pedestrian ( lower deck )
Remarks: Between Sunnyside and 8 Street SW stations ; lower deck is a pedestrian walkway
Connects Eau Claire Park pathway with west part of Prince 's Island Park , provides access to Enmax stage
Connects Prince 's Island Park with Sunnyside , also crosses Memorial Drive
Connects Prince 's Island Park with Eau Claire
Connects eastern Prince 's Island Park with Eau Claire and Chinatown
Connects Downtown Calgary to Crescent Heights ; lower deck connects Chinatown to Memorial Drive
Connects Memorial Drive to Downtown Calgary
Connects Downtown Calgary to Memorial Drive , Crescent Heights and Bridgeland
Connects Bridgeland to Downtown Calgary ; south terminus of Edmonton Trail . Formerly called the Langevin Bridge ( 1910-2017 ) , named for Sir Hector Langevin
Between 3 Street SE and Bridgeland/Memorial stations

Bridge: George C. King Bridge ( formerly St. Patrick 's Island Bridge )
Remarks: Connects Downtown East Village , Fort Calgary and Bow River pathways with St Patrick Island and Calgary Zoo ; new project to cross to Bridgeland
Connects main Calgary Zoo exhibits with the Prehistoric Park
Connects main Calgary Zoo exhibits with the Canadian Wilds
